Detailed Description

A base class for Value Browser items. Should not be used directly.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

TBaseItem::TBaseItem ( TValueBrowser *  parent,
const QString &  name,
int  page = -1,
int  id = -1 
)

Constructor. "parent" is the TValueBrowser parent (can not be 0). "name" is the name of the item (text shown for user). "page" is the number of the page the item should be moved (-1 by default, which means the current page). "id" is the unique identifier of the item (-1 by default, which means no id).

TBaseItem::TBaseItem ( TBaseItem *  parent,
const QString &  name,
int  id = -1 
)

Constructor. "parent" is the TValueBrowser parent (can not be 0). "name" is the name of the item (text shown for user). "id" is the unique identifier of the item (-1 by default, which means no id).

virtual bool TBaseItem::editable (  )  [pure virtual]

Returns true if the item is editable, false if not.

virtual bool TBaseItem::visible (  )  [inline, virtual]

Returns true if the item is visible, false if not. Visibility is page-independent.

Since:
3.2

virtual bool TBaseItem::hasValue (  )  [pure virtual]

Returns true if the item provides a value, false if not.

Implemented in TBaseValue, and TBaseGroup.

virtual void TBaseItem::storeSet ( bool  emitChanges = false  )  [virtual]

Copies current data into stored set.

Reimplemented in TBaseValue.

virtual void TBaseItem::restoreSet (  )  [virtual]

Copies stored data into current set.

Reimplemented in TBaseValue.

void TBaseItem::setCheckPropertyName ( const QString &  name  ) 

Sets check property name to name. This name will be used for settings file while TValueBrowser::writeDataSet() or TValueBrowser::readDataSet() is called, to store item's check state. If name is empty, no check property will be stored/read to/from settings file.

See also:
checkProperyName(), addCheckProperty()

const QString& TBaseItem::checkProperyName (  )  const [inline]

Reads check property name.

See also:
setCheckPropertyName(), addCheckProperty()

void TBaseItem::setCheckLinked ( void *  linked,
int  type = TValueBrowser::LT_BOOL 
)

Sets linked value for check flag to linked, and type to type. If linked is 0 then no linked value will be connected with check.

See also:
addCheckProperty()

void TBaseItem::addCheckProperty ( const QString &  name = QString::null,
void *  linked = 0,
int  type = TValueBrowser::LT_BOOL 
)

Quick method to enable check state, set check property name to name, linked value to linked, and type to type.

See also:
setCheckLinked(), checkProperyName(), setCheckPropertyName()

virtual void TBaseItem::updateFromLinked (  )  [virtual]

Reads value from linked variable and puts it to the browser.

Reimplemented in TBaseValue.

virtual void TBaseItem::updateLinked (  )  [virtual]

Stores current value from the browser to linked one.

Reimplemented in TBaseValue.

virtual void TBaseItem::writeDataSet ( QSettings &  set  )  [pure virtual]

Stores linked value to set.

Implemented in TBaseValue, TBaseGroup, TColorValue, and TFontValue.

virtual void TBaseItem::readDataSet ( QSettings &  set  )  [pure virtual]

Reads linked value from set.

Implemented in TBaseValue, and TBaseGroup.

bool TBaseItem::setItemLevel ( int  level = 0  ) 

Sets level of the item to level. This is need to be used for own values only, followed with quick-added children.

virtual void TBaseItem::onChangeItem ( int   )  [protected, virtual]

Called internally when the item changes.

Since:
3.2

virtual const QIcon TBaseItem::itemIcon (  )  [inline, protected, virtual]

Returns icon for data picked out of list. Should be reimplemented in subclasses in order to provide own icons.

Reimplemented in TColorValue, and TFontValue.

virtual int TBaseItem::iconSpace (  )  const [inline, protected, virtual]

Returns size between icon and editor line. Sometimes should be reimplemented in subclasses in order to provide correct distance.
